issue.title: x.com
issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://x.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fx.com%2FPETEandrepete_%2Fstatus%2F1788379241815445981) ### Comment > I use the app “Downie” https://software.charliemonroe.net/downie/ to download audio, video, and images from various websites. One such was of starting a download is to paste the URL of a page that contains the item you want to download. > > This works 100% of the time for everything EXCEPT Twitter. Excuse me, X.com. > > So say I want to download this gif of a tornado that I just tweeted. The URL is https://x.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981 and pasting this directly into Downie will cause an error "Error: Cannot find configuration URL.” > > If the URL is simply changed to https://twitter.com/PETEandrepete_/status/1788379241815445981 then it downloads perfectly. > > This ONLY happens when AdGuard is running. Disable it and you can now use either x.com or twitter.com URLs. > > A while back I THOUGHT i had nailed this down as being related to DNS Protection, which i had been using at the time. Seems like when I changed it or disabled it the problem went away, however that is not the case as of now. So the only workaround is to change the URL manually. Username: `@petekjohnson` ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/2hn926dr1ym8ssscccswg0osw4g4ccge5e4zuoc6nw.jpg?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/3avlpgf7gpmookk8wwok00go80g0k0or8jv4569tsg.jpg?nc=1)
Screenshot 3 ![Screenshot 3](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/4inmkqoses6cwck00k0g4kggk084w4scuu435qluj4.jpg?nc=1)
Screenshot 4 ![Screenshot 4](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/k5j80az0yyo00ggogs4gs0c0ccgs8kkplp9qmb41k0.jpg?nc=1)
Screenshot 1 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 1](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/olobxet5y68wskgs4cgks00wc0cg04gtbazl40rees.jpg?nc=1)
Screenshot 2 with AdGuard disabled ![Screenshot 2](https://cdn.adguard.info/sitereports/dy5dcp60nvkgg4c0so84gws4sk4soocl2sdssp4tf4.jpg?nc=1)
### System configuration Information | Value --- | --- AdGuard product: | AdGuard for Mac v2.14.0.1599 nightly System version: | macOS 14.5 Beta (23F5074a) Browser: | Safari License type: | paid Stealth mode options: | Block Java,
Strip URLs from tracking parameters,
Hide your search queries,
Send Do-Not-Track header,

Block trackers DNS filtering: | disabled Filters: | Ad Blocking:

issue.title: Cookies notice

labels.name: Stale

issue.body:

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

Annoyances — pop-ups, cookie warnings, etc.

other (specify in comment below)

Mobile

https://www.truecaller.com

comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

performed_via_github_app.name: GitHub Actions
performed_via_github_app.description: Automate your workflow from idea to production
